vossen_en_konijnen.model.actor

Class Rabbit

  • java.lang.Object
    • vossen_en_konijnen.model.actor.Animal
      • vossen_en_konijnen.model.actor.Rabbit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Actor

    public class Rabbit
extends Animal
    A simple model of a rabbit. Rabbits age, move, breed, and die.
    Version:
    2015.01.31
    Author:
    David J. Barnes, Michael KÃ¶lling, Ronald Scholten

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rabbit

        public Rabbit(boolean randomAge,
              Field field,
              Location location,
              boolean gender)
        Create a new rabbit. A rabbit may be created with age zero (a new born) or with a random age.
        Parameters:
        randomAge - If true, the rabbit will have a random age.
        field - The field currently occupied.
        location - The location within the field.

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act(java.util.List<Actor> newRabbits)
        This is what the rabbit does most of the time - it runs around. Sometimes it will breed or die of old age.
        Specified by:
        act in interface Actor
        Specified by:
        act in class Animal
        Parameters:
        newRabbits - A list to return newly born rabbits.

      • findFood

        private Location findFood()
        Look for rabbits adjacent to the current location. Only the first live rabbit is eaten.
        Returns:
        Where food was found, or null if it wasn't.
